page.title: 16THE STUD AND THE COMMUNITY
page.content: The foals stay at{Hare Park}Stud until they are yearlings, and then they are either put into training (usually locally, at one of the many such establishments in or around Newmarket) or sent to the local sales in Newmarket, which are held between September and November each year. Hay and corn are bought from specialist corn merchants in Newmarket. All the other stable equipment also comes from Newmarket. All the horses and foals on the farm are thoroughbreds and are especially bred for flat racing (of which Newmarket is recognised as the world's capital). This is an ideal area for the rearing of horses for racing and it contains all the natural and commercial resources for a successful stud farm.
